thread.title: Randy Quaid Speaks Out About Arrest and Freedom: 'I've Been Snapped from the Jaws of Defeat'
thread.title_full: Randy Quaid Speaks Out About Arrest and Freedom: 'I've Been Snapped from the Jaws of Defeat'

title: Randy Quaid Speaks Out About Arrest and Freedom: 'I've Been Snapped from the Jaws of Defeat'
text:
Entertainment Randy Quaid Speaks Out About Arrest and Freedom: 'I've Been Snapped from the Jaws of Defeat' Posted just a moment ago 
Monty Brinton/CBS (NEW YORK) -- Actor Randy Quaid and his wife Evi were surprisingly set free in a Vermont courtroom Thursday after a judge unexpectedly released them, one week after the couple was arrested after entering the U.S. from Canada, where they've lived the last five years. On Friday's Good Morning America , Quaid, in his first interview since the ruling, described how he felt. 
"Literally like, I've been snapped from the jaws of defeat," he said, still sporting a shaggy white beard. 
The couple also shared what they want the public to know about their legal situation. "We own our house," Evi declared. 
"Yeah, that's the bottom line," Randy agreed. "This is just a property dispute." 
The two are considered by the state of California to be fugitives from the law after being accused of felony vandalism to a home they once owned. Still, the Quaids aren't out of the woods just yet. The Santa Barbara District Attorney's Office said in a statement they still have a warrant for the couple's arrest, adding if they should leave Vermont and enter another state, they should expect to be arrested again. 
Now that they've apparently won one battle, Quaid said he's ready to get back to work. "I hope...you'll see me real soon out there on the big screen or the small screen or Netflix or wherever it may be," he said on GMA . 
The Independence Day star also had a message for fans: "I'd just like to thank everyone for all their nice thoughts and support."
